properties.title: Golden Cross Inn

properties.address: St Owen Street, Hereford, Herefordshire HR1 2PR
properties.description: Open Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Hereford St John's Methodist Church offers a warm safe space on Saturdays in St Owen Street. Call in and see us on Saturday mornings 10am to 12.30pm, we are a Place of Welcome offering a Warm Welcome this winter, a safe space for everyone, and a Talk Community Hub. On our menu we have:- Tea, Coffee and Toast, Soup and Beans Conversation, chat and discussion Free Wi-Fi, and computer access, we can print things out A place for small children to play We can look thinks up for you on the internet or refer you to support groups and help. We can be found in St John's Methodist Church on St Owen Street, or via our back door in East Street. Here you will find a warm welcome.

hours._text: Saturday: 10:00 - 13:00

properties.title: Leominster Baptist Church

properties.description: Thursdays - 10am to 1pm The warm space is within the ECHO Shop in Leominster. We will be offering free coffee, hot chocolate, tea and a range of herbal teas. We will also have free fresh cakes and biscuits on offer. We are also encouraging people to bring a craft activity with them or just pop in for refreshments and a chat. We have an accessible toilet. Bank holidays and public holidays may offer different opening times, check directly with the venue

properties.description: The Courtyard is open from 10am, Monday – Saturday. Box Office and The Courtyard Shop are open 10am – 8pm, Monday – Saturday. In the case of performances that occur on Sundays the venue will be open from 1 hour prior to the start of the first performance of the day. Bank holidays and public holidays may offer different opening times, check directly with the venue.

properties.title: The Courtyard

properties.description: Monday to Friday - 9am to 4pm We will continue to provide a warm, safe space for anyone who needs it. We are a registered Talk Community Hub offering support and signposting to those who need it, including on cost-of-living pressures, housing, health & wellbeing. We will provide food and drink, an opportunity for people to take part in activities and respond to requests for new things to take part in. We will continue to operate our community larder. Bank holidays and public holidays may offer different opening times, check directly with the venue.

properties.title: The Salvation Army Church and Community Centre

properties.description: Tuesday - 3pm to 5pm The Hope Centre are running their warm space every Tuesday from 3pm to 5pm, and have free refreshments (tea and their lovely cake), the option to sit and chat to others, and to make use of the community laptops if anyone would like to. There are no questions asked, just come along if you need somewhere warm to relax. Bank holidays and public holidays may offer different opening times, check directly with the venue
